text: William Snodgrass (4 September 1827 - 22 July 1906) was a Canadian Presbyterian minister and the sixth Principal of Queen's College, now Queen's University. Under his tenure, the position of chancellor and the university council were created, the Queen's Journal released its first issue, and Queen's was yet again saved from financial ruin through an aggressive and very successful fundraising campaign. == External links == * Biography at The Dictionary of Canadian Biography Online Category:1827 births Category:1906 deaths Category:Canadian Christian religious leaders Category:Canadian educators Category:Principals of Queen's University at Kingston Category:Canadian Presbyterian ministers
title: William Snodgrass (minister)
